column2: Role    Position : Quality Analyst | "German Quality Analyst" IGT Solutions is looking for   "German Quality Analyst"  to lead business operations in a Contact Centre services environment. The position is responsible for the overall leadership of the International Travel operations providing strategic and tactical operational direction to the team in order to achieve desired business goals and to ensure customer delight through close interaction with the leadership   Roles & Responsibilities: Able to effectively meet contractual SLAs pertaining quality audit targets Deliver feedback on all audited transactions within the specified timelines Conduct Team briefings on product & process updates, performance, qualitative inputs, Accuracy, top errors identified through monitoring Lead calibration sessions with cross function teams to ensure quality standards are maintained Perform regular hygiene checks to ensure specific abnormalities are highlighted to the internal team Ability to coach at an advisor level & review performance on the end metric CCR, C-SAT, Accuracy Visual Management - Team wise daily and MTD scores on Quality, CSAT, CCR to help in identifying gaps in the Process or Technology & make recommendations to streamline the same. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, OTHER ABILITIES- Very Strong written and verbal communication skills (English) Customer/ Client Handling Skills Ability to work during all shifts Strong supervisory skills with an eye for detail. Result Oriented. Sound knowledge of MS Office (Specially Excel, Word and PPT) Knowledge of all QC Tools like Pareto, Six Sigma. FMEA, SIPOC etc. Must have experience in German Language Required Candidate profile Min. 1 Yrs to 4 Yrs. of experience in Quality  Good communication skills, well versed with audits, call quality and QC tools. Graduate Interested Candidate share the resume sonam.singh1@igtsolutions.com Working Hours : 24 x 7 Shift 9 hours shift with 1 hour break. Work From Office Working Days: 5 Days working in a week  Benefits: Rewards & Recognition (Awards & Gifts)
column11: B2, Call Monitoring, Call Quality, Call Audit, German Language, Feedback, Calibration, B1

column2: Job description Roles And Responsibilities: Plan and conduct German language training sessions for individuals and groups, incorporating interactive activities, multimedia resources, and real-life scenarios to facilitate language acquisition. Develop and customise course materials, lesson plans, and assessments aligned with the proficiency levels and learning objectives of students. Assess students' language skills, track their progress, and provide constructive feedback to support their development. Create a supportive and inclusive learning environment that encourages active participation, collaboration, and cultural immersion. Stay updated on the latest trends, methodologies, and resources in language teaching and integrate innovative techniques into instructional practices. Maintain accurate records of attendance, grades, and other relevant data, and communicate regularly with students and management regarding course updates and performance. Participate in professional development activities, workshops, and conferences to enhance teaching skills and knowledge of German language and culture. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in German language, linguistics, education, or related field; Master's degree preferred. Native or near-native proficiency in German, with excellent oral and written communication skills. Proven experience in teaching German as a foreign language to learners of various proficiency levels and age groups. Strong understanding of language teaching methodologies, instructional design principles, and assessment strategies. Certification in German language teaching (e.g., Goethe-Institut, TestDaF) preferred. Experience with language teaching technologies, digital learning platforms, and multimedia resources. Excellent organisational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple tasks effectively. Strong interpersonal skills, patience, and enthusiasm for working with diverse learners. Interview Will Be In Person Only. Interview Location: Rajouri :-   A-33&34, Ring Road, Block A, Rajouri Garden, New Delhi, Delhi 110027. Link: -   https://maps.app.goo.gl/rd9ZCXubtt9H79KA8 Job Type :  Both Full-Time and Part-Time available Salary :  Will Be Disclosed In The Interview Round. Schedule :  Day Shift/ Work From Office Who Can Apply? -Candidates Who Are Available To Join Immediately -Ready To Work From The Office -Who Are Staying In Delhi NCR Contact Person :-  Goldi Roy  Contact Num :-  7815948127
